cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
do_not_disturb.feature:
Feature: Do Not Disturb
   
   As a Shouty user, I want to set a Do Not Disturb so I do not get notified by ALL or SELECTED Shouts.
    
    Scenario: New user 
        Given Lisa is a new user at 0, 0
        And Matt is at 0, 500
        When Matt shouts
        Then Lisa should hear Matt
        
    Scenario: Listener has shouter set to do not disturb
        Given Brad is a user
        And Matt is a user
        And Brad has filtered Matt to do not disturb
        When Matt shouts
        Then Brad should not hear Matt
        
    Scenario: Listener has one shouter set to do not disturb 
        Given Brad is a user
        And Matt is a user
        And Oscar is a user
        And Brad has filtered Matt to do not disturb
        When Matt and Oscar shout
        Then Brad should hear Oscar
        But Brad shoult not hear Matt
        
#    Scenario: Listener has do not disturb turned on
#        Given James is a user
#        And Lucy is a user
#        And has do not disturb set to on
#        When Lucy shouts
#        Then James should not hear Lucy
       
#    Scenario: Listener has do not disturb turned off
#        Given James is a user
#        And Lucy is a user
#        And has do not disturb set to off
#        When Lucy shouts
#        Then James shoult hear Lucy
hear_shout.nofeature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres

    Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0
    #@WFH
    Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are located at
        | name | x | y |
        | Lucy | 0 | 0 |
        | Sean | 0 | 500 |
        | Oscar | 1100 | 0|
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear shout from Oscar
        But Lucy should hear Sean
   # @wip    
    Scenario: Should not hear own shout
        When Lucy shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear shout from Lucy 
        
    Scenario Outline: only hear in-range shouts
        
        And Sean is at <Seans-location>
        When Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should <what-Lucy-hears>
        
        Examples: some simple examples
            | Seans-location | what-Lucy-hears      |
            | 0, 900         | hear Sean            |
            | 800, 800       | not hear anything    |
    
    Scenario: Multiple shouts from one person
         
        And Sean is at 0, 500
        When Sean shouts
        And Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean
